1.title: What Is This Website?
1.body:
This website is here for me to build whatever I want, when I want, and to not have any more excuses. I've tried time and time again to start a side project, get a hobby, put myself out there, to just DO SOMETHING. But I struggle very hard with thinking that whatever I do has to be perfect. It has to be meticulously planned and flawlessly executed in order for it to be worth anything. But I know deep down that thinking that way is really just an excuse not to do anything at all. It's as if by telling myself that if I were to do something it would be perfect, makes it ok to just do nothing instead.

This website is my way of telling myself to cut the bullshit, and just start working on something. It doesn't matter how perfect something is in my head if I never actually try to make it.

This website is my playground. This is where I get to build my own stuff without excuses and without fear of making it perfect. It's going to be ugly in the beginning, and that's ok. I have to be okay with that if I'm going to make anything at all. But hopefully I'll keep working on it, keep making it better, and make myself better in the process.

Throughout it all, I plan to share my thoughts, plans, and experiences through this blog. That part of this project is a big task for me, because if you haven't figured it out already, I am not a writer. I dreamed of becoming a famous author as a kid, but the reality is, I don't write. I don't even journal. But I want to have this blog as my place to reflect and look back on my past experiences. So I apologize to whomever is reading this for my rambling sentences and grammar mistakes, I'm surprised you've even made it this far. The whole point of this website, and this blog is to be ok with imperfection. So I don't plan on revising this post until I'm happy with it, because I never will be. Instead I will focus on just writing, and putting this out there. No matter the end result.

So what's the point of this? What even is this website? - To tell the truth, it's my own personal hot mess, and I love it.

Plans

This first step for this website is to just get it online. There are a lot of hidden steps in "just get it online", but that is the focus. I'm not going to care about proper styling or design, or about setting up a database for my blog posts, or any kind of testing or deployment steps. My only goal, is set up a project, and get it hosted.

After that, it's all about iterations. I should set up a DB for the blog posts, add search, start adding some design elements, add more content in general, maybe I'll get fancy and make a chat bot AI of myself. Who knows! The whole point is that I get to do whatever I want.

The only element to this website that I would love have that might need at least a little up front planning, is to have some kind of "time machine" where you could go back and see previous iterations. Imagine I get to version 20, and the website looks nice, it has lots of content, animations, and 100 blog posts. But if you "time travel" to version 1, you get to see this. This version. Just a single blog post and some plain HTML. That's something I really want, because it will let me see how far I've come.

The problem with that is managing different versions of components, styles, and features. How do I make clear divisions between the versions? It will probably be a matter of good organization and file structure. Something I'm not particularly good at. But That's the point, isn't it!

Conclusion

Essentially, this website is for me, and you're welcome to visit anytime :)
